Delta_Functor Delta_Functor::addFunctor ( const Delta_Functor  toAdd  ) 

Definition at line 49 of file DeltaFunctor.cpp.

00050 {
00051     if (toAdd.totalStartTime < this->totalStartTime) {
00052         this->totalStartTime = toAdd.totalStartTime;
00053     }
00054     if (toAdd.totalEndTime > this->totalEndTime) {
00055         this->totalEndTime = toAdd.totalEndTime;
00056     }
00057     this->totalTimeRange = this->totalEndTime - this->totalStartTime;
00058     if (totalTimeRange == 0) {
00059         totalTimeRange = 1; //Don't divide by zero
00060     }
00061     functors.push_back(toAdd);
00062     return * this;
00063 }

double Delta_Functor::getValue (  ) 

Definition at line 225 of file DeltaFunctor.cpp.

00226 {
00227     int currentTime = SDLLoader::getTime();
00228     double toReturn = 0;
00229     if (startTime <= currentTime && endTime >= currentTime)
00230     {
00231         toReturn += pow((double)(currentTime - startTime)/(double)timeRange, exponent)*valueRange + startValue;
00232     }
00233     else if (isCyclic && startTime <= currentTime) //Interesting fact - we only want to perform the cyclic behaviour IF the functor has started. I think that this makes a lot of sense. If you want it to go always, simply start your functor at 0.
00234     {
00235         int cycleTime = (currentTime - startTime /*interval*/) % (int)timeRange + startTime;
00236         toReturn += pow((double)(cycleTime - startTime)/(double)timeRange, exponent)*valueRange + startValue;
00237     }
00238     else
00239     {
00240         toReturn = 0;
00241     }
00242 
00243     //Add on any other functors that are contained within this one
00244     for (std::list<Delta_Functor>::iterator i = functors.begin(); i != functors.end(); i++)
00245     {
00246         toReturn += i->getValue();
00247     }
00248     return toReturn;
00249 }
